page.title: 11Farming
page.content: Farming, which often has to be combined with paying guests for a living, is the main occupation. The land is poor and usually run as family farms today, combining the land from two holdings and selling the spare house. There is mostly mixed farming and a milk lorry collects daily. The main cattle breed is the black and white Fresian, and a few extra heifer calves may be reared as herd replacements. There is a growing number of suckling calves for beef due to aid from government grants. Fell sheep crossed with a ram from a softer breed are kept on high ground but no-one farms exclusively sheep. Many farmers substitute silage for haymaking. No crops other than grass are grown, and the fields are surrounded by stone or upright slab walls sometimes combined with hedges.
